p: After establishing the antibacterial activity and time course of lethal action of the essential oils and the major components, their activity against the drug resistant pathogenic bacteria isolated from human patients was studied. As expected lemon grass oil was found to be the most potent against all the pathogenic drug resistant bacteria tested. However the studies clearly demonstrate antibacterial properties of some of the test compounds and suggest their potential use as chemotherapeutic agents, disinfectants or food preservants.
